User error; in order to reuse a layer by name you should be giving it a name via the name argument:

normalized_x = tf.layers.batch_normalization(
    x, training=True, reuse=None, name='my_bn')
normalized_x_test = tf.layers.batch_normalization(
    x_test, training=False, reuse=True, name='my_bn')

Indeed, if you don't provide a name to your layer, TF has no way to know which layer you are referring to when specifying reuse=True.

body:
User error; in order to reuse a layer by name you should be giving it a name via the `name` argument:

```python
normalized_x = tf.layers.batch_normalization(
    x, training=True, reuse=None, name='my_bn')
normalized_x_test = tf.layers.batch_normalization(
    x_test, training=False, reuse=True, name='my_bn')
```

Indeed, if you don't provide a name to your layer, TF has no way to know *which* layer you are referring to when specifying `reuse=True`.
